Class JSONParser<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • JSONParser<T>

  • public abstract class JSONParser<T>
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JSONParser()
      This class implies you're looking for local host.
      JSONParser(java.lang.String baseURL)
      When using this class it is standard that you'll be getting your json info from a base.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JSONParser

        public JSONParser()
        This class implies you're looking for local host.

      • JSONParser

        public JSONParser(java.lang.String baseURL)
        When using this class it is standard that you'll be getting your json info from a base.
        Parameters:
        baseURL - The base url. If you want to get information from google.com use http://google.com and so on.

    • Method Detail

      • readJSONFromUrl

        public static org.json.JSONObject readJSONFromUrl(java.lang.String url)
                                           throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                                  java.io.IOException,
                                                  org.json.JSONException
        Reads from a url and returns a single JSON Object.
        Parameters:
        url - The full url to the json object
        Returns:
        A JSON Object.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - If the URL isn't correct this exception occurs
        java.io.IOException - If IO magically doesn't work
        org.json.JSONException

      • readJSONFromUrl

        public org.json.JSONObject readJSONFromUrl()
                                    throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                           java.io.IOException,
                                           org.json.JSONException
        This class will read a JSON from a url given when instantiating the class. If no url is given feel free to give.
        Returns:
        Returns a JSONObject to be used for other parts.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        java.io.IOException
        org.json.JSONException

      • getArray

        public java.util.List<T> getArray(java.lang.String urlAppendage)
                           throws org.json.JSONException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        This will get a list of all the json objects. This is used if the the object is in an array.
        Parameters:
        urlAppendage - url containing the json objects.
        Returns:
        List of objects after they're converted to whatever you convert them too.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - This is thrown if this is an object or possibly not a json object
        java.io.IOException

      • getSingle

        public T getSingle(java.lang.String urlAppendage)
            throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                   java.io.IOException,
                   org.json.JSONException
        This will get a single JSON Object and parse it into the specified "T" object.
        Parameters:
        urlAppendage - This is in addition to the base url
        Returns:
        Gets specified object.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - Throws this exception if urlAppendage does not go to a proper url
        java.io.IOException
        org.json.JSONException - The url works but the address does not have a JSON output.

      • postRequest

        public void postRequest(java.lang.String urlAppendage,
               org.json.JSONObject object)
                 throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Use this when wanting to POST data in the form of JSON Object.
        Parameters:
        urlAppendage - This adds to the baseURL. If you want to go to http://example.com/1 Your base URL would be http://example.com/ and your urlAppendage would be 1
        object - This JSONObject must already have all the elements you want to put in.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - If the url is incorrect such as http://example.com//1. urlAppendage might give this error
        java.io.IOException

      • postRequest

        public void postRequest(java.lang.String urlAppendage)
                 throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                        java.io.IOException
        For POST data. It will take the url and convert this class into a JSON object using the putJSONObjects method. This should only be used if the extended class can transform JSON objects.
        Parameters:
        urlAppendage - This will add to the base URL
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - The URL is incorrect.
        java.io.IOException

      • putJSONObjects

        public abstract org.json.JSONObject putJSONObjects()
        This method will take the classes existing data structures and turn them into an array. Used for put and post requests. Usually to do this the following code is created JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(); jsonObject.put("Key", "Value"); return jsonObject;
        Returns:
        Returns a JSONObject with all key value pairs.

      • putRequest

        public void putRequest(java.lang.String urlAppendage,
              org.json.JSONObject jObject)
                throws org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteRequest

        public void deleteRequest(java.lang.String urlAppendage)
                   throws org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Uses a HTTP DELETE command to delete whatever is pointed at the URL.
        Parameters:
        urlAppendage - This will tack on to the base url and is where the delete command will be pointed
        Throws:
        org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
        java.io.IOException
